description.narrative: Define a national strategy necessary for implementing an effective Anti-Money Laundering/Counter-Terrorist Funding (AML/CFT) regime. Develop the capacity of the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) so that it meets all international operational standards and best practices. Deliver training and mentoring to build the capacity of government officialspolice, prosecutors, judiciary, bank supervisors and private sector stakeholdersin the identification, investigation, and prosecution of money laundering predicate crimes and other financial crimes. Build capacity of AML/CFT reporting entities including the banking, securities, insurance, and gaming sectors.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt & Infrastructure Finance - South East Asia Regional IFT

description.narrative: Provide recommendations for institutionalizing the prioritization of alternative energy projects; development of a methodology for identifying, valuing, and allocating project risks; design of roadmap for financing of future power generation and/or purchases by Independent Power Producers; staff capacity building activities that will increase institutional knowledge for project finance such as for feasibility studies, requests for proposals and contracts, financial structure, contract negotiation, tender and bidder selection, and condition precedent to project construction; development of a "front office" function that can manage an outreach program to mobilize private investment (international and domestic) in renewable energy projects..
